intro: Lotononis involucrata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its velvety leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb, often forming a rosette of leaves near the ground. Its flowers are usually violet or purple in color and bloom during the warmer months. It is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
